MyWork

Check out some of my projects...

[job]RANGER

Tech Stack ASP.NET using Razor Pages, SQL database, C#, and Azure Publish

What? A job search helper (1) supplies links to over 30 job boards, (2) stores Employer, Job, and Contact info, (3) tracks to-dos and activity history, and more!

Why? I needed to keep track of the job search so why not build an app to help?

[job]RANGER Github

Tech Stack React, React-Materialize, Node, Express, MySql, Sequelize, MomentJS, Yummly API

What? Shopping list assistant designed to write a user's shopping list based on her previous purchase history. Also supplies help to reduce waste, offers recipes, share shopping lists with others and more!

Why? Everybody needs help controlling costs and waste through better planning.

My Role Database and model management; component architecture, design and construction; the logic behind the auto-list writing features; and extensive testing.

YOSO: You Only Shop Once Github

Tech Stack React, UIkit

What? A simple matching/memory game

Why? Built to demonstrate basic understanding of React state, components, and the passing of props in a single page React App.

Pick Your Poison Github

Tech Stack Node, Express, Axios, Cheerios, MongoDb, Mongoose, UIkit

What? The app scrapes news sites, grabs articles, displays links to those articles, allows users to comment on the articles and saves the comments to a MongoDb database.

Why? Very lean Full Stack app that demonstrates web scraping.

News Scraper Github

Tech Stack HTML, CSS, and JavaScript

What? Basic Hangman style word guess game with a philosophical theme.

Why? Demonstrates very basic understanding of the coordination of HTML, CSS, and JavaSript in a single page app.

Plato's Revenge Github

Tech Stack HTML, CSS, JavaScript

What? A browser based game requiring the user to do a bit of math to make the right decision about how to commit resources.

Why? Demonstrates object-oriented programming in a single page app. Also deploys vanilla JavaScript to demonstrate some significant DOM manipulation.

Star Wars Pit Fight Github

Tech Stack HTML, CSS, Firebase, MomentJS

What? Simulates a message delivery service using a GOT theme that schedules ravens for message delivery, calculates a cost and time of both message delivery and return message delivery to anywhere in Westeros relative to Oldtown.

Why? Demonstrates the use of time in an single page app.

Raven's Nest Oldtown Github

Tech Stack HTML, CSS, JavaScript, Local Storage, AJAX

What? Hits the giphy API to show and save Gifs. Users can search for whatever they want, save their searches, and save favorite Gifs all to local storage.

Why? Besides demonstrating AJAX API calls, shows how to use local storage as a persistent memory alternative.

Gif Adventures Github

Tech Stack HTML, CSS, JavaScript, Materialize, Firebase, Swiper, Metronome, YouTube API, Songster API

What? A guitar learner helper that offers guitar tabs, song sheets, tuning help, and access to YouTube instructional videos based on songs the user wants to learn.

Why? Puts many important learning tools for guitar or bass players in one easy to use app.

My Role User authentication via Firebase, basic JavaScript support for display of tables and API calls.

A1 Guitar Learner Github

Tech Stack Node, Inquirer, MomentJS, Node Spotify API, OMDB API, Bandsintown API, Request

What? Pure Node CLI app that allows the user to call various APIs for movie, song, and musician information. Uses Inquirer for basic user interface.

Why? Demonstrates the power of back-end resource utilization, including API calls, file manipulation, and using the backend to handle logic.

Liri Node.js App Github

Tech Stack JavaScript, Node, Inquirer, Request

What? A word guess game that deploys JavaScript "classes" to build objects to do the work. Makes use of the Oxford Dictionary API to create words to guess.

Why? Demonstrates importing and exporting of classes and functions for multiple files for use in a main application.

Constructor Word Guess App Github

Tech Stack JavaScript, Node, Inquirer, Request, MySql

What? A fake Amazon app that allows users to "buy" from a selection products available in 5E Dungeons and Dragons. Uses the Inquirer interface to guide the user through the app.

Why? Demonstrates use of MySql database to hold persistent data. Also demonstrates async functionality in the backend environment.

Bamazon Github

Tech Stack HTML, CSS, Node, Express, UIkit

What? Very basic full-stack app demonstrating fundamentals of routing pages using Express.

Why? Hey man, everybody starts somewhere.
